raw_json.html_title: ClipPath copies filename and path from windows for loading into R | R-bloggers
raw_json.main_html:
ClipPath copies filename and path from windows for loading into R

Posted on September 4, 2009 by Stephen Turner in R bloggers | 0 Comments

[This article was first published on Getting Genetics Done, and kindly contributed to R-bloggers]. (You can report issue about the content on this page here)
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.

I wish I would have discovered this long ago.  Loading data into R or MySQL requires you to specify the full path to the file.  If you do this on a Windows machine there are two annoyances.  First, if you save something to your desktop the path to your desktop is really long.  Second, windows by default uses backslashes “\” in the file path, while R or other software requires forward slashes “/”.

Related

To leave a comment for the author, please follow the link and comment on their blog: Getting Genetics Done.
R-bloggers.com offers daily e-mail updates about R news and tutorials about learning R and many other topics. Click here if you're looking to post or find an R/data-science job.
